Crimes.Legal_Issue: Breach of procedural fairness due to non-disclosure of information
Crimes.Procedural_Context: Non-disclosure of redacted documents for national security reasons
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: Not applicable – credibility not challenged directly
Crimes.Legal_Provision: Section 35(2) of the Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Crimes.Basis_of_Claim: Applicant sought relief from inadmissibility based on diplomatic status
Crimes.Key_Factor_in_Determination: Minimal redaction justified by national security concerns
Crimes.Decision_Maker: Minister of Immigration, Refugees and Citizenship
Crimes.Assessment_Standard: Procedural fairness balanced against national security
Crimes.Evidence_Ignored: Minor redacted portions (few paragraphs out of 702 pages)
Crimes.Application_Factor: Association with regime involved in human rights violations
Crimes.Cause_of_Refusal: Association with regimes involved in genocide and human rights violations
Crimes.Evidentiary_Issues: Partial non-disclosure due to national security
Crimes.Document_Fraud: Misrepresentation through omission or association in documentation
Crimes.Credibility_Issues: Not central – focus on admissibility, not truthfulness
Crimes.Omission_Type: Withholding of sensitive national security-related information

Crimes.Crime_Name: Inadmissibility for being a senior official of a government engaged in systematic or gross human rights violations
Crimes.Crime_Type: Human Rights Violations and Serious International Law Offenses
Crimes.Grounds_for_Claim: Inadmissibility under immigration law due to high-level government role
Crimes.Remedy_Requested: Exemption from inadmissibility and grant of permanent residence
Crimes.Evidence_Requirement: Evidence of association with human rights-violating regime
Crimes.Government_Body_or_Authority: Minister of Immigration, Refugees and Citizenship
Crimes.Exemptions_or_Defenses_Cited: Request for humanitarian and compassionate considerations
Crimes.Evidence_Type: Official records, background intelligence, diplomatic history
Crimes.Nature_of_Participation: Senior diplomatic official in implicated regime
Crimes.Temporal_Context: Historical involvement during period of human rights abuses
Crimes.Assessment_Standard: Risk to national interest and moral culpability
Crimes.Complaint_Issues: Fairness in assessment of past governmental roles
Crimes.Protection_Claim: None – applicant was not a refugee claimant
Crimes.Credibility: Not disputed – based on official position held
Crimes.Risk_Nature: Moral and legal responsibility due to office held
Crimes.Legal_Basis: Inadmissibility for complicity via high-ranking role
Crimes.Victim_Basis: Ethnic and political groups targeted during Rwandan genocide

Crimes.Crime_Name: Complicity in acts of an offending government
Crimes.Crime_Type: Human Rights Violations and Serious International Law Offenses
Crimes.Grounds_for_Claim: Alleged complicity through official role in violating regime
Crimes.Remedy_Requested: Relief from inadmissibility under humanitarian grounds
Crimes.Evidence_Requirement: Demonstration of knowledge or benefit from human rights violations
Crimes.Government_Body_or_Authority: Minister of Immigration, Refugees and Citizenship
Crimes.Exemptions_or_Defenses_Cited: Lack of direct personal involvement; diplomatic immunity argument implied
Crimes.Evidence_Type: Service record, intelligence reports, public documentation
Crimes.Individual_Status_or_Claim: Former ambassador applying for permanent residence
Crimes.Nature_of_Participation: High-level representation of regime linked to atrocities
Crimes.Assessment_Standard: Whether presence is detrimental to national interest
Crimes.Protected_Group: Tutsi population and political opponents in Rwanda
Crimes.Risk_Factor: Symbolic endorsement of regime through continued service
Crimes.Credibility: Accepted as former ambassador; no challenge to identity
Crimes.Risk_Nature: Moral and symbolic complicity through office
Crimes.Legal_Basis: Inadmissibility due to association with gross human rights violations
Crimes.Victim_Basis: Ethnic and political victims of state-sponsored violence

Crimes.National_Security_Element: Association with regime involved in genocide
Crimes.National_Security_Danger: Risk of harboring individuals linked to mass atrocities
Crimes.Threat_Assessment: Indirect threat through affiliation with criminal regime
Crimes.Risk_Factor: Past high-level government role in human rights-abusing state
Crimes.Nature_of_Acts: Support or representation of regime responsible for genocide
Crimes.Target_Entity: Canadian immigration system and public trust
Crimes.Individual_Behavior: Seeking residency while linked to serious violations
Crimes.Age_at_Time_of_Membership: Adult, serving in professional diplomatic role
Crimes.Evidence_Type: Redacted intelligence, official records, biographical data
Crimes.Credibility_Factors: Consistency of records and lack of dispute over position held
Crimes.Evidence_Issues: Limited redaction affecting minor portion of file
Crimes.Standard_of_Proof: Balance of probabilities in administrative context
Crimes.Legal_Standard: Procedural fairness with national security exception
Crimes.Authority_Body: Minister of Immigration, Refugees and Citizenship
Crimes.Decision_Level: Administrative decision subject to judicial review
Crimes.Process: Administrative review followed by judicial appeal
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Extent of obligation to disclose sensitive information
Crimes.Procedural_Fairness_Issue: Whether redaction undermined ability to respond
Crimes.Review_Standard: Was the decision rational and procedurally fair?
Crimes.Deportation_Risk: Potential future removal if status not regularized
